objective: By 2026-02-14, increase /orgx/live onboarding-start conversion to 15% and drive 60 successful OrgX workspace connects (pairing or API key) with 20 weekly active dashboards.

target_audience.primary_icp: Builders and operators shipping agentic workflows (founders, product/eng leads, ops leads) who need a single place to monitor agents, unblock approvals, and keep execution aligned.
target_audience.secondary_icp: Teams adopting OpenClaw who want orchestration and auditability without standing up a separate control plane.
pain_points: Agent runs feel like a black box: you cannot quickly see what is happening, what is blocked, and what is next.
Approvals and decisions get lost in chat tools, slowing execution and creating rework.
Work tracking drifts: plans, tasks, and what agents are actually doing fall out of sync.
When connectivity is flaky, events get dropped and you lose a reliable execution timeline.
Teams want a low-friction setup (pairing or key) that works locally first, then scales.

offer.primary: A live command center for OrgX inside OpenClaw: watch execution, approve decisions, and track progress in real time.
offer.setup: Install the plugin, open /orgx/live, then connect via browser pairing or API key.
offer.risk_reversal: Explore the demo dashboard or continue offline first; connect when ready.

proof_points: Activity Timeline with threaded session views.
Initiatives, workstreams, milestones, and tasks visible in Mission Control.
Agent status + current tasks surfaced without hunting across tools.
SSE live stream plus local fallback paths.
Outbox buffering + replay visibility for offline events.
Automatic model tier routing (opus/sonnet/local) by task type.

hypotheses.hypothesis: If we lead with 'single live dashboard' + explicit proof (decisions queue, mission control, offline replay), then more users will start onboarding because the value is concrete and de-risked.
hypotheses.how_to_test: A/B test hero headline + subhead; measure click-through on primary CTA and onboarding-start rate.
hypotheses.success_criteria: Primary CTA CTR +25% and onboarding-start conversion >= 15%.

notes.naming: Task request says /live; plugin route is /orgx/live. This campaign targets both: /live as marketing entry and /orgx/live as the actual dashboard.
notes.compliance: Avoid unsupported performance claims; keep proof points tied to shipping features listed in repo docs.
